xidplus.catalogue module¶

xidplus.catalogue.create_XIDp_MIPScat_nocov(posterior, prior24)¶

creates the XIDp catalogue in fits format required by HeDaM :param posterior: posterior class :param prior24: prior class for 24 microns :return: thdulist: astropy fits hdulist

creates the XIDp catalogue in fits format required by HeDaM

Parameters:
  • posterior – posterior class
  • prior100 – prior class for 100 microns
  • prior160 – prior class for 160 microns
Returns:

thdulist: astropy fits hdulist

creates the XIDp catalogue in fits format required by HeDaM

Parameters:
  • posterior – posterior class
  • prior250 – prior class for 250microns
  • prior350 – prior class for 350 microns
  • prior500 – prior class for 500 microns

thdulist: astropy fits hdulist

xidplus.moc_routines.check_in_moc(ra, dec, moc)¶

Check whether a source is in MOC or not

Parameters:
  • ra – Right Ascension
  • dec – Declination
  • moc – MOC
Returns:

boolean array expressing whether in MOC or not :rtype: boolean array

  • dec – Declination of sources

Parameters:

  • wcs – wcs information

MOC :rtype: pymoc.MOC
xidplus.moc_routines.get_HEALPix_pixels(order, ra, dec, unique=True)¶

Work out what HEALPix a source is in

Parameters:
  • order – order of HEALPix
  • ra – Right Ascension
  • dec – Declination
  • unique – if unique is true, removes duplicate pixels
Returns:

list of HEALPix pixels :rtype:
xidplus.moc_routines.get_fitting_region(order, pixel)¶

expand tile by quarter of a pixel for fitting

:param order:the HEALPix resolution level :param pixel:given HEALPix pixel that needs to be fit :return: HEALPix pixels that need to be fit

xidplus.moc_routines.sources_in_tile(pixel, order, ra, dec)¶

Check which sources are HEALPix pixel

Parameters:
  • pixel – HEALPix pixel
  • order – order of HEALPix pixel
  • ra – Right Ascension
  • dec – Declination
Returns:

boolean array expressing whether in MOC or not :rtype:boolean array
xidplus.moc_routines.tile_in_tile(order_small, tile_small, order_large)¶
Routine to find our what larger tile to load data from when fitting smaller tiles.
Returns larger tile no. Useful for when fitting segmented maps on HPC using a hierarchical segmentation scheme
Parameters:
  • order_small – order of smaller tile
  • tile_small – tile no. of smaller tile
  • order_large – order of larger tiling scheme
Returns:

pixel number of larger tile

xidplus.posterior module¶

class xidplus.posterior.posterior_stan(fit, priors)¶

Bases: object

convergence_stats(fit)¶

Extract convergence statistics from the pystan fit object

Parameters:fit – fit object from pystan
covariance_sparse(threshold=0.1)¶

Create sparse covariance matrix from posterior.

Only stores values that are greater than given threshold (default=|0.1|)

quantileGet(q)¶

get percentile (q) for all fitted parameters

Parameters:q – percentile e.g. 16,50,84..
Returns:array containing percentile for parameter
scale_posterior(priors)¶

Stan searches over range 0-1 and scales parameters with flux limits. This function scales those parameters to flux values

Parameters:priors – list of prior classes used in fit
xidplus.posterior.scale_posterior(priors, posterior, log=True)¶

(redundant)Stan searches over range 0-1 and scales parameters with flux limits. This function scales those parameters to flux values

Parameters:
  • priors –
  • posterior –
  • log –

:return:posterior

xidplus.prior module¶

class xidplus.prior.prior(im, nim, imphdu, imhdu, moc=None)¶

Bases: object

cut_down_cat()¶

Cuts down prior class variables associated with the catalogue data to the MOC assigned to the prior class: self.moc

cut_down_map()¶

Cuts down prior class variables associated with the map data to the MOC assigned to the prior class: self.moc

cut_down_prior()¶

Cuts down prior class variables to the MOC assigned to the prior class: self.moc

get_pointing_matrix(bkg=True)¶

Calculate pointing matrix. If bkg = True, bkg is fitted to all pixels. If False, bkg only fitted to where prior sources contribute

get_pointing_matrix_coo()¶

Get scipy coo version of pointing matrix. Useful for sparse matrix multiplication

prior_bkg(mu, sigma)¶

Add background prior. Assumes normal distribution with mean=mu and standard deviation=sigma

Parameters:
  • mu – mean
  • sigma – standard deviation
prior_cat(ra, dec, prior_cat_file, flux_lower=None, flux_upper=None, ID=None, moc=None, flux_scale=False)¶

Input info for prior catalogue

Parameters:
  • ra – Right ascension (JD2000) of sources
  • dec – Declination (JD2000) of sources
  • prior_cat_file – filename of catalogue
  • flux_lower – lower limit of flux for each source
  • flux_upper – upper limit of flux for each source
  • ID – HELP_ID for each source
  • moc – Multi-Order Coverage map
prior_cat_stack(ra, dec, prior_cat, ID=None)¶

Input info for prior catalogue of sources being stacked

Parameters:
  • ra – Right ascension (JD2000) of sources
  • dec – Declination (JD2000) of sources
  • prior_cat – filename of catalogue
  • ID – HELP_ID for each source
set_prf(prf, pindx, pindy)¶

Add prf array and corresponding x and y scales (in terms of pixels in map)

Parameters:
  • prf – n x n array, where n is an odd number, and the centre of the prf is at the centre of the array
  • pindx – n array, pixel scale of prf array
  • pindy – n array, pixel scale of prf array
set_tile(moc)¶

Update prior with new MOC and update appropriate variables :param moc: Multi-order Coverage map from pymoc

upper_lim_map()¶

Update flux upper limit to |bkg|+2*sigma_bkg+max(D) where max(D) is maximum value of pixels the source contributes to

xidplus.segmentation.Segmentation_scheme(inra, indec, inID, tile_l)¶

For a given prior catalogue, create a tiling scheme with given tile size. Returns tiles for which there are sources
